news.headline: America’s labor market is cooling, and workers are quietly turning to Uber and DoorDash to fill the income gap
news.summary: A new Goldman Sachs analysis found that platform-based gig work opportunities are holding up. 20% of people who lost pay, lost a job, or had hours cut turned to gig platforms to make up the difference, the analysis said.
news.article_text:
America's labor market continues to cool, and the gig economy is quietly absorbing some of the employment strain being felt across the country.

A new Goldman Sachs analysis found that platform-based gig work opportunities — which include major tech players like Uber (UBER), DoorDash (DASH), and Instacart (CART) — are holding up as traditional payroll growth cools.

About 20% of people who lost pay, lost a job, or had hours cut turned to gig platforms to make up the difference, the analysis said

news.headline: America’s labor market is cooling, and workers are quietly turning to Uber and DoorDash to fill the income gap
news.summary: A new Goldman Sachs analysis found that platform-based gig work opportunities are holding up. 20% of people who lost pay, lost a job, or had hours cut turned to gig platforms to make up the difference, the analysis said.
news.article_text:
America's labor market continues to cool, and the gig economy is quietly absorbing some of the employment strain being felt across the country.

A new Goldman Sachs analysis found that platform-based gig work opportunities — which include major tech players like Uber (UBER), DoorDash (DASH), and Instacart (CART) — are holding up as traditional payroll growth cools.

About 20% of people who lost pay, lost a job, or had hours cut turned to gig platforms to make up the difference, the analysis said

news.summary: Thomson Reuters (TSX:TRI) is projecting earnings growth of 8.6% per year. Annual revenue growth is set for 7.5%, comfortably above the broader market’s 5.1% expectation. Current net profit margins are 23.8%, down from
news.article_text: Thomson Reuters (TSX:TRI) is projecting earnings growth of 8.6% per year, trailing the Canadian market's expected 12.1% pace. Annual revenue growth is set for 7.5%, comfortably above the broader market’s 5.1% expectation. Current net profit margins are 23.8%, down from 31.2% last year. news.headline: Schiff Warns Of MicroStrategy's 'Death Spiral': Says Dividends Can Just Disappear
news.summary: Peter Schiff says MicroStrategy Inc's (NASDAQ:MSTR) high-yield preferred shares are dangerously misunderstood by investors. Schiff argues the shares function more like optional coupons at the company's discretion, not traditional cumulative preferreds where skipped payments accrue.
